comment:
The create controller uses model registry data and HTTP post variables to edit, filter, and save
  data, verifying foreign key restraints, expected values, permissions, etc. In addition, the create
  controller schedules before and after create events.

class_properties.name: runtime_data
class_properties.comment: Stores an array of key/value runtime_data settings

class_properties.name: plugin_data
class_properties.comment: Stores an array of key/value plugin data settings

class_properties.name: query_results
class_properties.comment: Set of rows returned from a query

class_properties.name: row
class_properties.comment: Single set of $query_results and used in create, update, delete operations

class_properties.name: null_date
class_properties.comment: Used in queries to determine date validity

processFieldGroup.name: processFieldGroup
processFieldGroup.comment: processFieldGroup - runs custom filtering, defaults, validation for a field group

checkForeignKeys.name: checkForeignKeys
checkForeignKeys.comment: checkForeignKeys - validates the existence of all foreign keys

xonBeforeCreateEvent.name: xonBeforeCreateEvent
xonBeforeCreateEvent.comment: Schedule Event onBeforeCreateEvent Event - could update model and data objects

setModelRegistrySQL.name: setModelRegistrySQL
setModelRegistrySQL.comment: Based on Model Registry, set default SELECT, FROM and WHERE clauses for query

setSelectColumns.name: setSelectColumns
setSelectColumns.comment: Uses joins defined in model registry to build SQL statements

setSpecialJoins.name: setSpecialJoins
setSpecialJoins.comment: Uses joins defined in model registry to build SQL statements

setWhereElement.name: setWhereElement
setWhereElement.comment: Add Model Registry Criteria to Query

setModelRegistryCriteria.name: setModelRegistryCriteria
setModelRegistryCriteria.comment: Uses joins defined in model registry to build SQL statements

runQuery.name: runQuery
runQuery.comment: Build the SQL needed for the query

triggerOnBeforeReadEvent.name: triggerOnBeforeReadEvent
triggerOnBeforeReadEvent.comment:
Schedule onBeforeRead Event
     
      - Model Query has been developed and is passed into the event, along with runtime_data and registry data
     
      - Good event for modifying selection criteria, like adding tag selectivity, or setting publishing criteria
     
      - Examples: Publishedstatus

get.name: get
get.comment: Get the current value (or default) of the specified property

setType.name: setType
setType.comment: Set Query Type - create, select (default), update, delete, exec

getDateFormat.name: getDateFormat
getDateFormat.comment: Returns a database driver compliant date format for PHP date()

getDate.name: getDate
getDate.comment: Retrieves the current date and time formatted compliant with the database driver

getNullDate.name: getNullDate
getNullDate.comment: Returns a database driver compliant value for null date

       For Insert and Update, only, value and data_type

comment:
The delete controller uses model registry data and HTTP post variables to verifying foreign key restraints,
  and permissions, etc, archive version history, and delete data. The delete controller also schedules the
  before and after delete event.

delete.comment: Delete row and plugin other delete actions

      - Model Query has been developed and is passed into the event, along with runtime_data and registry data
     
      - Good event for modifying selection criteria, like adding tag selectivity, or setting publishing criteria
     
      - Examples: Publishedstatus

comment:
The delete controller uses model registry data and HTTP post variables to verifying foreign key restraints,
  and permissions, etc, archive version history, and delete data. The delete controller also schedules the
  before and after delete event.

class_properties.name: runtime_data
class_properties.comment: Stores an array of key/value runtime_data settings

class_properties.name: plugin_data
class_properties.comment: Stores an array of key/value plugin data settings

class_properties.name: query_results
class_properties.comment: Set of rows returned from a query

class_properties.name: row
class_properties.comment: Single set of $query_results and used in create, update, delete operations

class_properties.name: null_date
class_properties.comment: Used in queries to determine date validity

cancel.name: cancel
cancel.comment:
cancelItem
     
      Method to cancel an edit.
     
      Tasks: cancel and close

restore.name: restore
restore.comment:
restore
     
      Method to restore a version history record to the current version.
     
      uses saveItem to process save after preparing the data

saveItemBatch.name: saveItemBatch
saveItemBatch.comment:
saveItemBatch
     
      Called from UpdateController::processItem to obtain a current row and prepare data for a new item
     
      uses saveItem to process save after preparing the data

apply.name: apply
apply.comment:
apply, create, save, saveascopy, saveandnew
     
      Methods used to save a record with different redirect results.
     
      Tasks: apply, create, save, saveascopy, saveandnew all processed by saveItemForm to prepare data
      and then SaveItem to actually save the data

saveItemForm.name: saveItemForm
saveItemForm.comment:
saveItemForm
     
      Used to obtain form data and send to saveItem for save processing
     
      Method called by apply, create, save, saveascopy and saveandnew actions

saveItem.name: saveItem
saveItem.comment:
saveItem
     
      Method to save a record from a form, as a copy of another record, or using a version history restore.
     
      Calling methods include: saveItemForm, saveItemBatch,
     
      Also batch-copy uses SaveItem, as well

comment:
The update controller handles all update tasks, such as reorder, checkin, sticky, feature, archive, and
  normal update row processing by interacting with associated model registry data and HTTP post variables
  to edit, filter, and save data, verifying foreign key restraints, expected values, permissions, etc.
  In addition, the update controller schedules before and after update events.

class_properties.name: runtime_data
class_properties.comment: Stores an array of key/value runtime_data settings

class_properties.name: plugin_data
class_properties.comment: Stores an array of key/value plugin data settings

class_properties.name: query_results
class_properties.comment: Set of rows returned from a query

class_properties.name: row
class_properties.comment: Single set of $query_results and used in create, update, delete operations

class_properties.name: null_date
class_properties.comment: Used in queries to determine date validity

copy.name: copy
copy.comment:
copy, move or delete -> processFeatureChange -> processItems
     
      call processItems which loops through the ids and calls saveItemBatch or deleteItemBatch
     
      saveItemBatch prepares the copy or move data and calls saveItem
      deleteItemBatch handles the delete processing

archive.name: archive
archive.comment:
archive, publish, unpublish, spam, trash (state) -> processFeatureChange -> processIems
     
      call processStateChange which then calls processItems which loops through the ids

feature.name: feature
feature.comment:
feature, unfeature -> processFeatureChange -> processItems
     
      call processStateChange which then calls processItems which loops through the ids

sticky.name: sticky
sticky.comment:
sticky, unsticky -> processStickyChange -> processItems
     
      call processStateChange which then calls processItems which loops through the ids

checkin.name: checkin
checkin.comment:
checkin -> processItems
     
      call processStateChange which then calls processItems which loops through the ids

processItems.name: processItems
processItems.comment:
processItems
     
      called by single item methods to loop through the ids and processed by processItem

processItem.name: processItem
processItem.comment:
processItem
     
      called by copy, move, and delete to loop through the ids and call either saveItemBatch or deleteItemBatch
     
      saveItemBatch prepares the copy or move data and calls saveItem
      deleteItemBatch handles the delete processing

setSelectColumns.comment: Uses joins defined in model registry to build SQL statements

class_properties.comment: Schedule Event - anonymous function to FrontController schedule_event method

get.name: get
get.comment: Locates folder/file associated with Namespace for Resource

Xml file is located, read, loaded using Simplexml into a string and then sent back
       or processed by the Configuration Dataobject or Model utility

getCollection.comment: Retrieve a collection of a specific handler

set.name: set
set.comment: Set the value of a specified key

get.name: get
get.comment: Get the current value (or default) of the specified key

getConfiguration.name: getConfiguration
getConfiguration.comment: Load registry for requested model resource, returning name of registry collection

exists.name: exists

checkLock.name: checkLock
checkLock.comment:
Returns true if the registry is locked
      Returns false if there is no registry and if the registry is locked
     
      Usage:
      $this->registry->checkLock('Namespace');

createRegistry.name: createRegistry
createRegistry.comment:
Create a registry for the specified namespace
     
      Notes:
      - All namespaces are set to lowercase to remove case sensitivity
      - Throws exception if namespace is reserved
      - Returns namespace if already existing (Note: Use 'exists' to verify prior to creation)
      - Called automatically when needed by a set for a namespace or for the member of a namespace
     
      Usage:
       $this->registry->createRegistry('Namespace');

get.name: get

set.name: set
set.comment:
Sets the value for a specific namespace item
     
      Use $match to ensure member exists prior to setting value
     
      Usage:
      $this->registry->set('Namespace', 'key_name', $value);

copy.name: copy
copy.comment:
Copy key values from one namespace registry into another, overwriting existing values in the other registry
     
      Note:
      If target_registry already exists, source_registry values replace existing values for matching keys
      Key pairs on target registry remain unchanged if there are no matching pairs. Use Delete first, if desired.
      Use merge when target registry values should remain -- not be overwritten.
     
      Usage:
      $this->registry->copy('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y');
     
      To copy only certain values:
      $this->registry->copy('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y', 'wildcard');

merge.name: merge
merge.comment:
Merge one Namespace into another
     
       - When keys match, target value is retained
       - When key does not exist on the target, it is copied in
           In either of the above cases, when "remove_from_source" is 1, the source entry is removed
       - If no entries remain in the source after the merge, the empty source registry is deleted
     
      Usage:
      $this->registry->merge('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y');
     
      Merge a subset of source using wildcard:
      $this->registry->merge('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y', 'Only These');
     
      Merge a subset of source using wildcard, and then delete the source merged in:
      $this->registry->merge('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y', 'Only These', 1);

delete.name: delete

rename.name: rename

getArray.name: getArray

loadArray.name: loadArray

listRegistry.name: listRegistry
listRegistry.comment:
Retrieves a list of ALL namespace registries and optionally keys/values
     
      Specify $expand = true to return the entire list, and the member names and values in each registry
     
      Usage:
      $this->registry->listRegistry();

getData.name: getData
getData.comment:
getData - returns Registry (comes from $model_name) as Query Results (array of objects)
     
      Data can be requested as a result - provide $registry, $element and true for $single result
     
      Use '' in the key to retrieve all values starting with a specific phrase (ex. 'model')

getConfiguration.name: getConfiguration
getConfiguration.comment: Load registry for requested model resource, returning name of registry collection

getIncludeCode.name: getIncludeCode
getIncludeCode.comment: Parse xml recursively, processing all include statements

getIncludeCodeLoop.name: getIncludeCodeLoop
getIncludeCodeLoop.comment: Parse xml recursively, processing all include statements

setElementsRegistry.name: setElementsRegistry
setElementsRegistry.comment: Define elements for Data Model to Registry

setJoinFields.name: setJoinFields
setJoinFields.comment: Process join field definitions for registry

getCustomFields.name: getCustomFields
getCustomFields.comment: getCustomFields extracts field information for all customfield groups

getCustomFieldsSpecificGroup.name: getCustomFieldsSpecificGroup
getCustomFieldsSpecificGroup.comment: Load Custom Fields for a specific Group -- this is called once for each custom field type for a Model

inheritCustomFieldsSpecificGroup.name: inheritCustomFieldsSpecificGroup
inheritCustomFieldsSpecificGroup.comment: Inherited fields are merged in with those specifically defined in model

inheritDefinition.name: inheritDefinition
inheritDefinition.comment: Inheritance checking and setup  <model name="XYZ" extends="ThisTable"/>

comment: Named pair storage by Namespace with local or global persistence
author: Amy Stephen

class_properties.name: registry
class_properties.comment: Array containing all namespace registries and associated data

exists.name: exists
exists.comment:
Does it exist? Useful for verifying existence of namespace and/or namespace element.
       Note: Does not create the namespace or member, simply tests if it has already been created.
     
      Usage:
      $this->registry->exists('Namespace', 'Optional member');

checkLock.name: checkLock
checkLock.return:
bool    true - lock is on
                       false - there is no lock (and possibly no registry, either)

createRegistry.name: createRegistry
createRegistry.comment:
Create a registry for the specified namespace
     
      Notes:
      - All namespaces are set to lowercase to remove case sensitivity
      - Throws exception if Registry Namespace is reserved
      - Returns Namespace if already existing (use 'exists' if verification is needed prior to createRegistry)
      - Called automatically when needed by a Set Request
     
      Usage:
       $this->registry->createRegistry('Name Space');

get.name: get

set.name: set

copy.name: copy
copy.comment:
Copy key values from one namespace registry into another, overwriting existing values
     
      Note:
      If target_registry already exists, source_registry values replace existing values for matching keys
      Key pairs on target registry remain unchanged if there are no matching pairs. Use Delete first, if desired.
      Use merge when target registry values should remain -- not be overwritten.
     
      Usage:
      $this->registry->copy('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y');
     
      To copy only certain values:
      $this->registry->copy('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y', 'wildcard');

merge.name: merge
merge.comment:
Merge one Namespace into another.
     
       - When keys match, target value is retained
       - When key does not exist on the target, it is copied in
           In either of the above cases, when "remove_from_source" is 1, the source entry is removed
       - If no entries remain in the source after the merge, the registry is removed, too
     
      Usage:
      $this->registry->merge('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y');
     
      Merge a subset of source using wildcard:
      $this->registry->merge('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y', 'Only These');
     
      Merge a subset of source using wildcard, and then delete the source merged in:
      $this->registry->merge('namespace-x', 'to-namespace-y', 'Only These', 1);

delete.name: delete

rename.name: rename

getArray.name: getArray

loadArray.name: loadArray

listRegistry.name: listRegistry

getData.name: getData
getData.comment:
getData - returns Registry (comes from $model_name) as Query Results (array of objects)
     
      Data can be requested as a result - provide $registry, $element and true for $single result
     
      Use '' in the key to retrieve all values starting with a specific phrase (ex. 'model')

getRegistry.name: getRegistry

deleteRegistry.name: deleteRegistry
deleteRegistry.comment: Delete a Registry for specified Namespace

editNamespace.name: editNamespace
editNamespace.comment: Used internally for data validation of namespace element

editNamespaceKey.name: editNamespaceKey
editNamespaceKey.comment: Used internally for data validation of namespace key element

class_properties.comment: Schedule Event - anonymous function to FrontController schedule_event method

class_properties.comment: Used in queries to determine date validity
